builders.entity_graph_builder.description: Wraps pre-enriched code entities into graph nodes for the entity graph.

metadata.name: builders.entity_graph_builder
metadata.description: Wraps pre-enriched code entities into graph nodes for the entity graph.
metadata.docstring_full:
Wraps pre-enriched code entities into graph nodes for the entity graph.

Assumes upstream loader (code_loader) has already attached all required metadata,
including tags, docstring status, and test coverage placeholders.

Output format conforms to the `entity_graph.json` specification.

builders.entity_graph_builder.build_enti.description: Wrap each enriched entity into a compliant graph node.

metadata.name: build_entity_graph
metadata.description: Wrap each enriched entity into a compliant graph node.
metadata.docstring_full:
Wrap each enriched entity into a compliant graph node.

Parameters:
    entities (list[dict]): Raw or enriched entity records.

Returns:
    dict: fqname â†’ wrapped graph node

builders.linkage_builder.description: Adds call relationships between entities in the graph.

metadata.name: builders.linkage_builder
metadata.description: Adds call relationships between entities in the graph.
metadata.docstring_full:
Adds call relationships between entities in the graph.

Uses AST parsing to detect structural function calls, updates each node with:
- calls_fqns
- called_by_fqns
- links: [ { target, type: "calls" } ]
- is_orphaned (recomputed after linkage)

builders.linkage_builder.extract_called_.description: Parses source code and extracts all function names that are called.

metadata.name: extract_called_functions
metadata.description: Parses source code and extracts all function names that are called.
metadata.docstring_full:
Parses source code and extracts all function names that are called.

Parameters:
    source (str): The raw source code of a .py file

Returns:
    list[str]: All direct call targets (unqualified names)

builders.linkage_builder.inject_call_lin.description: Injects structural call links into the entity graph.

metadata.name: inject_call_links
metadata.description: Injects structural call links into the entity graph.
metadata.docstring_full:
Injects structural call links into the entity graph.

Parameters:
    entity_graph (dict): Entity metadata keyed by fqname
    project_root (str): Project root to re-open source files

Returns:
    dict: The enriched graph with linkage info

metadata.name: builders.usage_map_builder
metadata.description: Usage Map Builder (builders)
metadata.docstring_full:
Usage Map Builder (builders)

Constructs a forward/reverse reference graph showing usage across the entity set.
Useful for auditing call relationships beyond simple call trees.

builders.usage_map_builder.build_usage_m.description: Create bidirectional usage summaries for each FQ name.

metadata.name: build_usage_map
metadata.description: Create bidirectional usage summaries for each FQ name.
metadata.docstring_full:
Create bidirectional usage summaries for each FQ name.

Parameters:
    graph (dict): Full graph with calls_fqns available on each node

Returns:
    dict: { fqname: { used_by: [...], uses: [...] } }

metadata.name: builders.variable_usage_builder
metadata.description: Variable Usage Map Builder (builders)
metadata.docstring_full:
Variable Usage Map Builder (builders)

Finds all variables (top-level assignments) used in more than one module,
and records which modules use them.

builders.variable_usage_builder.build_va.description: For each variable, scan all other modules for references by name.

metadata.name: build_variable_usage_map
metadata.description: For each variable, scan all other modules for references by name.
metadata.docstring_full:
For each variable, scan all other modules for references by name.

Parameters:
    variables (list): List of variable nodes (from loader, type=='variable')
    all_source_files (list): List of all source Path objects
    root_path (Path): Project root for relative paths

Returns:
    dict: fqname -> list of modules (relative paths) where used

exporters.json_exporter.export_entity_gr.description: Exports the entity graph as a timestamped JSON file.

metadata.name: export_entity_graph
metadata.description: Exports the entity graph as a timestamped JSON file.
metadata.docstring_full:
Exports the entity graph as a timestamped JSON file.
The output filename includes both the project name and timestamp for traceability.
The file content wraps the graph dict with `timestamp` and `project_name` fields.

Args:
    graph (dict): Entity graph.
    output_dir (Union[str, Path]): Directory for output files.
    project_name (str): Project name for filename and metadata.
    timestamp (Optional[str]): Timestamp string (YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS). If not provided, uses current time.

Returns:
    dict: {"timestamped": path to timestamped entity graph JSON file}

exporters.usage_map_exporter.export_usag.description: Exports the usage map as a timestamped JSON file.

metadata.name: export_usage_map
metadata.description: Exports the usage map as a timestamped JSON file.
metadata.docstring_full:
Exports the usage map as a timestamped JSON file.
The output filename includes both the project name and timestamp for traceability.
The file content wraps the usage map dict with `timestamp` and `project_name` fields.

Args:
    usage_map (dict): Usage summary dictionary.
    output_dir (Union[str, Path]): Directory for output files.
    project_name (str): Project name for filename and metadata.
    timestamp (Optional[str]): Timestamp string (YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS). If not provided, uses current time.

Returns:
    dict: {"timestamped": path to timestamped usage map JSON file}

metadata.name: export_vault_index
metadata.description: Export a Markdown index listing all symbols in the vault, grouped by type.
metadata.docstring_full:
Export a Markdown index listing all symbols in the vault, grouped by type.

Args:
    graph (dict): Entity graph containing all symbols.
    output_dir (Union[str, Path]): Output directory.
    project_name (str): Optional project name prefix (unused).
    timestamp (str): Optional timestamp (unused).

Returns:
    str: Full path to the created index.md file.

metadata.name: loaders.asset_loader
metadata.description: Asset Loader (loaders)
metadata.docstring_full:
Asset Loader (loaders)

Extract asset metadata from tracked folders for non-code files and
emit graph-compliant symbol records for inclusion in the entity graph.

Scans all configured asset directories (from `asset_extensions` in `pilconfig.json`)
and returns standardized metadata records for each valid asset. These are merged into
the main entity graph alongside code functions and modules.

Supports extensions like `.png`, `.tmx`, `.glb`, `.sh`, `.json`, etc.

loaders.asset_loader.infer_tags_from_pat.description: Infer semantic tags from the file path and extension.

metadata.name: infer_tags_from_path
metadata.description: Infer semantic tags from the file path and extension.

loaders.asset_loader.export_path_list.description: Resolves path list entries to absolute paths, using config base dir as anchor.

metadata.name: export_path_list
metadata.description: Resolves path list entries to absolute paths, using config base dir as anchor.

loaders.asset_loader.load_asset_symbols.description: Scan the project_root recursively and extract metadata for all asset files.

metadata.name: load_asset_symbols
metadata.description: Scan the project_root recursively and extract metadata for all asset files.
metadata.docstring_full:
Scan the project_root recursively and extract metadata for all asset files.

@tags: ["assets", "symbol_generation"]
@status: "stable"
@visibility: "internal"

Parameters:
    config (dict): Loaded config containing at minimum:
                   - project_root
                   - asset_extensions (list)
                   - ignored_folders (optional)

Returns:
    list[dict]: Entity graph-ready asset symbol records

metadata.name: loaders.code_loader
metadata.description: Code Loader (loaders)
metadata.docstring_full:
Code Loader (loaders)

Walks the source tree and extracts all top-level symbols (functions, classes, methods, variables, modules).
Enriches each symbol with structured docstring metadata in bulk for efficient processing.

metadata.name: extract_nodes_from_ast
metadata.description: Extract all classes, functions, methods, variables, and modules from the AST of a source file.

loaders.code_loader.load_code_symbols.description: Parse a single Python file and return a list of symbols with metadata.

metadata.name: load_code_symbols
metadata.description: Parse a single Python file and return a list of symbols with metadata.

metadata.name: loaders.config_loader
metadata.description: Config Loader (loaders)
metadata.docstring_full:
Config Loader (loaders)

Loads and validates the pilconfig.json configuration file for the PIL project.
All relevant paths are resolved as absolute, relative to the config file location.

loaders.config_loader.load_config.description: Load the PIL project configuration from pilconfig.json and resolve all important paths.

metadata.name: load_config
metadata.description: Load the PIL project configuration from pilconfig.json and resolve all important paths.
metadata.docstring_full:
Load the PIL project configuration from pilconfig.json and resolve all important paths.

Args:
    config_path (str): Path to pilconfig.json file (absolute or relative)

Returns:
    dict: Configuration fields as a dictionary, all relevant paths absolute.

metadata.name: loaders.markdown_loader

Markdown Loader (loaders)

Parses Markdown files for structured metadata entries.
Used to populate the documentation and vault systems.

metadata.name: load_markdown_entries
metadata.description: Loads markdown entries from a .md file unless it resides in an ignored folder.

metadata.name: utils.docstring_utils
metadata.description: Docstring Utilities (utils)

utils.docstring_utils.check_docstring_si.description: Checks if the function docstring references the function name and its parameters.

metadata.name: check_docstring_signature_match
metadata.description: Checks if the function docstring references the function name and its parameters.

utils.docstring_utils.extract_docstring_.description: Extracts structured metadata from a docstring.

metadata.name: extract_docstring_metadata
metadata.description: Extracts structured metadata from a docstring.
metadata.docstring_full:
Extracts structured metadata from a docstring.

@tags: ["parser", "metadata"]
@status: "stable"
@visibility: "internal"

Parameters:
    docstring (str): Full function/class/module docstring

Returns:
    dict: Contains 'description', 'docstring_full', 'tags', 'journal', 'deprecated', plus optional future fields.

Supports:
    - @tags: ["tag1", "tag2"]
    - @journal: "linked entry"
    - @deprecated
    - @status: "draft"
    - @visibility: "internal"

utils.export_cleanup_utils.description: Cleans the exports directory before writing new output files.

metadata.name: utils.export_cleanup_utils
metadata.description: Cleans the exports directory before writing new output files.
metadata.docstring_full:
Cleans the exports directory before writing new output files.

Removes:
- entity graph JSONs
- function map exceptions
- usage maps
- variable usage reports

Leaves:
- Markdown vault content (assumed to be overwritten cleanly)
- Snapshots (handled separately)

utils.export_cleanup_utils.clean_exports.description: Removes stale JSON exports before writing new ones.

metadata.name: clean_exports_dir
metadata.description: Removes stale JSON exports before writing new ones.

Graph Utilities

Common functions for working with the code entity graph: walking nodes, traversing edges, etc.

utils.graph_utils.walk_graph.description: Walk the entity graph, applying a visitor function to each node.

metadata.name: walk_graph
metadata.description: Walk the entity graph, applying a visitor function to each node.
metadata.docstring_full:
Walk the entity graph, applying a visitor function to each node.
Optionally start at a subset of nodes; otherwise walk all.

Args:
    graph (dict): { fqname: node dict }
    visit (callable): function(fqname, node)
    start_nodes (set): Subset of fqn names to start from (optional)

Creates a compressed zip snapshot of the entire project_root.
Optionally attaches entity_graph.json for traceability and audit.

    config (dict): Loaded pilconfig for current run.
    entity_graph_path (str, optional): Path to entity graph export, if available.

Returns:
    Path: Full path to the created snapshot zip.
@tags: ["snapshot", "archive"]
@status: "stable"

metadata.name: utils.test_coverage_utils
metadata.description: Test Coverage Utilities (utils)
metadata.docstring_full:
Test Coverage Utilities (utils)

Provides functions to estimate static test coverage by scanning test files
and matching function/method/class names to code symbols.

utils.test_coverage_utils.estimate_test_.description: Updates the 'test_coverage' field for each symbol based on whether

metadata.name: estimate_test_coverage
metadata.description: Updates the 'test_coverage' field for each symbol based on whether
metadata.docstring_full:
Updates the 'test_coverage' field for each symbol based on whether
its function/class/method name appears in any test file.

Parameters:
    symbols (list[dict]): List of code symbol metadata dicts.
    test_dir (str): Directory containing test files.

Returns:
    list[dict]: The same list, with 'test_coverage' set for each symbol.

Unit tests for pil_meta.utils.export_cleanup_utils.

- Handles missing directory gracefully
